abstract.text: View major documentation updates and highlights from WWDC, browse ongoing updates from a set of framework releases over time, and jump to the latest release notes.
Learn about important changes to ARKit.
Learn about important changes to AVFAudio.
Learn about important changes to AVFoundation.
Learn about important changes to Accelerate.
Learn about important changes to Accessibility.
Learn about important changes in ActivityKit.
Learn about important changes to AdAttributionKit.
Learn about important changes to AppKit.
Learn about important changes to Apple Intelligence.
Learn about important changes to Apple Pencil.
Learn about important changes to Audio Toolbox.
Learn about important changes to AuthenticationServices.
Learn about important changes to Bundle Resources.
Learn about important changes to ContactsUI.
Learn about important changes to Core Location.
Make your appâ€™s content and actions discoverable with system experiences like Spotlight, widgets, and enhanced action capabilities of Siri, powered by Apple Intelligence.
An interface for exposing a custom type or app-specific concept to system experiences like Siri and the Shortcuts app.
Requests user confirmation before performing the app intent.
Errors that indicate that the app doesnâ€™t have required permission to perform an action
Unknown or unrecoverable error that might have occurred due to either a system or user error.
Errors that represent a state where a person needs to do respond in order to successfully completed successfully the action.
An app intent that starts, stops or otherwise modifies audio recording state.

Designates intent that will launch an activity that uses deviceâ€™s camera to capture photos or videos. Marking your intent with this protocol makes it available as a possible action for Camera quick action.
An interface for configuring a Control Center module.
An entity that refers to a document or other file.
`IndexedEntity` represents an App Entity decorated with an attribute set. A set of attributes that enable the system to perform structured indexing  and queries of entities.
An interface for providing an app entity that represents an on-disk file or file-based resource.
An app entity with a URL representation.
An app enum with a URL representation.
An app intent with a URL representation.
An entity that will only ever have one value, such as global settings.
A query designed for only returning a single possible value, provided by `uniqueEntity`. Protocol extensions will provide the other required query methods based on that.
Make core types or concepts discoverable to the system by declaring them as app entities.
Make your appâ€™s actions and content available to Siri and Apple Intelligence with assistant schemas.
A protocol that describes how a type interacts with transport APIs such as drag and drop or copy and paste.
Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
A representation of the state of your app at a moment in time.
The identifier of an app entity that you associate with the user activity.
